title: Has the Supreme Court ruled in 1943 that no one can be forced to participate in national rituals?
subtitle: The judgement of the Supreme Court of 1943 applied to staff of school boards and other government entities, not to private sector institutions such as the National Football Federation.
author: David Emery
vclaim: In 1943, the Supreme Court ruled that no one could be forced to participate in national rituals such as loyalty and national anthem, and therefore the call to expel the players of the Liberian National Armed Forces for "knepping" as a protest amounted to a call to break the law.
